channel.title: Changing the flashlight texture in Black Mesa?
channel.description:
Nope Black Mesa does not have one!
A textured flashlight can be added to black mesa by copying a texture to materials/effects
Name it flashlight001.vtf
you can get flashlight textures and change your flashlight like this, I messed about with it thought i would make a detailed flashllight and detail looks horrible on flashlights unless you want to call batman...
Anyway I made a flashlight texture after much messing around, the interesting thing is it will cast dynamic shadows when the texture is applied so it has a performance cost to it but It is a small thing I discovered, here is what I settled on after about 3 hours of mucking about. It's softer than black mesa's default flashlight too.
![](upload://3pZ8OB6nKYgXFtqglm44f7bWPr3.png)
download link
[url]https://www.mediafire.com/download/iuk2soo77pftkba/Flashlight+V2.rar[/url]
to uninstall remove the file vtf to revert bact to the plain dynamic light

I wanted a more horror type flashlight and this is the best I could do, this is only the tinted flashlight pictured if you install either you can delete it and then it will revert back to the default flashlight,

I’ll just say use the tinted flashlight from the pack it’s better. but other people have also modded flashlights but I think the problem that they suffer from is too much detail, a whole day on focusing on flashlight design, taught me this. no hard edges and no perfect circle

item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Yeah if you go to Source SDK 2007/vpks/depot_206_dir.vpk and open that up, you can navigate to hl2/materials/effects/flashlight001.vtf and see the default texture.

This one looks more like a flashlight, but as you said, your version is softer. It’s an interesting quick little mod that people can do if they want.
